byline.contributor: Samantha Schmidt reported from Hoboken, and Alan Feuer from New York. Emma G. Fitzsimmons contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By SAMANTHA SCHMIDT and ALAN FEUER

abstract: National Transportation Safety Board officials say New Jersey Transit engineer Thomas Gallagher has no memory of crash in Hoboken Terminal that killed one person and injured over 100 but says train was moving at slower speed than had been previously reported.
lead_paragraph: The engineer, Thomas Gallagher, also told investigators that the train was traveling about 10 miles an hour when it entered Hoboken Terminal, contradicting initial reports that it was moving faster.
snippet: The engineer, Thomas Gallagher, also told investigators that the train was traveling about 10 miles an hour when it entered Hoboken Terminal, contradicting initial reports that it was moving faster....

headline.main: N.J. Transit Engineer Has No Memory of Fatal Train Crash, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: N.J. Transit Engineer Has No Recollection of Fatal Crash
